intro: Psychotria sororiella, commonly known as the "blue psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria sororiella is also noted for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as tetrahydrocannabinol (THC).
